intro: Cynoglossum lamprocarpum, commonly known as the silverleaf forget-me-not, is a member of the Boraginaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its hairy, silver-green leaves and striking blue-violet flowers. Native to Central Asia, it thrives in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The plant's flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and wildflower landscapes.
